task_summary: Fold the pink cloth on the tabletop via push-and-press using a single PR2 arm, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 arm interacts with a pink cloth on a wooden tabletop to execute a single-fold using a push-based strategy visible across nine frames. The robot first perceives and approaches the cloth, aligns its end effector, gently makes contact, and pushes the cloth edge leftward to create a fold. After completing the push, it performs a brief press to set the crease and then retreats from the workspace. The sequence is consistent with the frames showing approach from the right, contact, progressive folding into a compact rectangle, and final withdrawal.
preconditions: Cloth lies flat and reachable on the table
Robot workspace is clear of obstacles
End effector suitable for pushing with open gripper
stepwise_plan: Detect and verify visibility of the cloth
Move above and align yaw with fold direction
Open gripper and lower until contact with the cloth edge
Execute one long push and a short finishing push leftward
Press lightly to set the crease
success_criteria: Cloth appears folded into a smaller, thicker rectangle
Folded state remains after tool retreat
No object slip or unintended displacement off the table
failure_and_recovery: If perception fails, repeat detection and re-approach
If contact is missed, lower again with small depth and retry push
If fold is shallow, perform the short finishing push once more
If cloth bunches, retreat, re-align, and re-contact before pushing
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreat and brief wait once a stable folded configuration is observed.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear contact with the cloth edge as the gripper lowers and aligns for pushing.
frame_3.predicts_next: Following frames should show lateral motion indicating a push to initiate folding.

node_specs.description: Perceive the cloth on the tabletop.
Verify that the cloth is visible before motion.
Move above the cloth to a safe pre-contact height.
Orient tool yaw to push leftwards.
Fine alignment over the cloth edge with tight tolerance.
Open gripper to present a flat pushing surface.
Lower until gentle contact with the cloth edge.
Primary push leftward to initiate the fold.
Short finishing push to complete the fold.
Brief press to set the crease.
Back off from the folded cloth.

failure_modes: Cloth not detected due to lighting or occlusion
Misalignment causes push to drag rather than fold
Excessive contact depth bunches the fabric
Push distance insufficient to complete fold
recovery_strategy: Adjust yaw and re-approach the edge
Reduce depth and retry contact before pushing
Execute finishing push again if fold is shallow
assumptions: Frames show a push-based single fold with a single arm approaching from the right; no grasp-lift required.
Direction of motion is right-to-left consistent with visible arm path and final folded shape.
No conflicting multi-object interactions are present.

expected_success_criteria: Cloth area halves with a defined crease
End effector retreats without disturbing folded state
